snippet: The United Nations General Assembly elected Jordan to the Security Council on Friday to replace Saudi Arabia, which after it won the seat in October rejected it to protest the Council’s failure to end the Syrian and Israeli-Palestinian conflicts.
abstract: United Nations General Assembly elects Jordan to replace Saudi Arabia on Security Council; Saudi Arabia rejected seat in October in protest of Council’s failure to end Syrian and Israeli-Palestinian conflicts.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations General Assembly elected Jordan to the Security Council on Friday to replace Saudi Arabia, which after it won the seat in October rejected it to protest the Council’s failure to end the Syrian and Israeli-Palestinian conflicts.
